intro: Centaurea acrolepis, commonly known as the purple centaury, is a flowering plant native to southern Europe and parts of North Africa. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky soils and thrives in sunny environments. Its flowers are usually purple or blue, with a central disk surrounded by ray florets. Centaurea acrolepis is often found in grasslands and open woodlands, where it plays a role in supporting local pollinators.
